About
About
I‚Äôm a consumer-first brand and innovation leader with 12 years of experience building memorable brands and launching impactful products across FMCG, e-commerce, D2C and consumer tech.

My journey spans iconic categories and disruptive challengers, from structured brand ownership at ITC and Johnson & Johnson, to the agile storytelling and content-led brand building at cult.fit and Wakefit.

My sweet spot lies at the intersection of brand, product and innovation - bringing new ideas to life, from positioning and GTM to scaling through creative campaigns and digital ecosystems.

üîπ Brand strategy, architecture & storytelling
üîπ Innovation & New Product Development (NPD)
üîπ Go-to-Market (GTM) and launch planning
üîπ Integrated campaigns (ATL + digital + influencer)
üîπ Consumer insight mining

Currently exploring meaningful brand-building opportunities where innovation, consumer empathy and creativity drive growth, especially in consumer-first categories like personal care, food & beverages, wellness, and lifestyle.

Always open to exchanging notes with fellow brand folks, creative thinkers, or product-led founders.

Drop me a note here or at phalguni.aneja@gmail.com
‚Ä¶see more

Activity

Loaded 9 Posts posts
Phalguni Aneja reposted this
Zoe Scaman
Zoe Scaman
   ‚Ä¢ 3rd+
Premium ‚Ä¢ 3rd+
Founder and Keynote Speaker at Bodacious, CSO at 77X (Luka Donƒçiƒá)
Founder and Keynote Speaker at Bodacious, CSO at 77X (Luka Donƒçiƒá)
1mo ‚Ä¢ Edited ‚Ä¢ 
 1 month ago ‚Ä¢ Edited ‚Ä¢ Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn
Look, I know I‚Äôm crossing some kind of invisible boundary - that professional/personal firewall so many of us have been taught to uphold, especially online, especially here.

But I‚Äôm going to keep posting about G@za. Every single day. Because this isn‚Äôt ‚Äújust politics.‚Äù It‚Äôs not a sidebar to the rest of life. It is life. And it is death. And it is funded by our taxes.

This is personal. It‚Äôs also deeply professional.

Because if your work is part of an industry that prides itself on being future-facing, empathetic, creative, or "people-first", then you don‚Äôt get to post ‚Äúhuman-centred design‚Äù slides in the morning and scroll past dead and starving babies in the afternoon. The cognitive dissonance should be unbearable. And if it isn‚Äôt, then that‚Äôs the real issue here.

We‚Äôve made a habit of compartmentalising. Taught to split ourselves: human over here, professional over there. Keep your outrage out of your deck. Keep your grief out of the Slack channel. Keep your conscience out of your keynote.

But the boundary was always a lie. A convenient fiction that allows industries to profit while staying apolitical. That lets people keep scrolling. That turns atrocity into abstraction.

Over 15,000 children have been killed. This isn‚Äôt a political debate. It‚Äôs a moral collapse. It‚Äôs a G-E-N-O-C-I-D-E. Say it with me - clearly, fully, without flinching.

So no, I‚Äôm not interested in your new ‚ÄúChatGPT cheat codes.‚Äù Or your hottest Gen Z trend report. Not because those things don‚Äôt matter. But because they don‚Äôt matter more.

If we can‚Äôt bring our full selves - grief, anger, accountability included - into our so-called professional spaces, then what exactly are we building?

Because whatever it is, it isn‚Äôt a better future.

------------

Side note - I see you, agency leaders and strategy heavyweights, checking out my LI profile after I share posts like this - where are your voices? where are your values? It's always the same old shit with you, all talk and no trousers. Cowards.
‚Ä¶more

I had the opportunity to work with Phalguni briefly during her internship at 20:20 Media. Although the period of time she spent with us was short, it was enough for her to showcase her positive attitude and high work ethic. 
 
She is a focused and competitive individual who learns quickly and applies expertly. Not only does she have a keen eye for detail and an innovative bent of mind, but is also a good humored person who believes in seeing the lighter side of things if the situation so demands. 
 
I recommend Phalguni highly, and wish her the best in all her future endeavors. 
 
Regards,
~ Abhimanyu Shankhdhar
